pageContext._xxxcollectionOwnerNamextxt: Library Special Collections and Archives, Virginia Commonwealth University
pageContext._xxxcollectionDescriptionxtxt: Contains papers relating to the founding of WRVA, Richmond in 1925 Virginia's first radio station. Includes daily program logs, 1925-1932, broadcast and publicity material, scrapbooks, photographs and some phonograph records. Lucy was an announcer, writer, producer, performer and general manager of the station during its early years. Also includes papers relating to the Lams & Brother Company, a tobacco firm that owned the station.
